title: Meatloaf
tagline: Moist inside, caramelized outside. The sheet pan method.
description: Moist, flavorful, with sticky-sweet glaze. Free-form method for better browning. Serves 8.
ingredients: Meatloaf: 2 lbs ground beef (80/20), 1 small onion grated (not diced), 3 garlic cloves minced, ¾ cup panko breadcrumbs, ½ cup milk, 2 eggs, 2 tbsp Worcestershire sauce, 1 tsp salt, ½ tsp black pepper, 1 tsp Italian seasoning
Glaze: ½ cup ketchup, 2 tbsp brown sugar, 1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F. Line a rimmed baking sheet with foil and set a wire rack on top (or just use foil).
Mix panko and milk in large bowl. Let sit 5 minutes (this is the panade).
Add beef, grated onion, garlic, eggs, Worcestershire, salt, pepper, and Italian seasoning. Mix gently with hands until just combined. Don't overwork.
Shape into a free-form loaf on prepared pan, about 9x5 inches.
Remove from oven, brush with half the glaze. Increase oven to 400°F.
Bake 15-20 more minutes until internal temp reaches 160°F. Brush with remaining glaze halfway through.
notes: GRATE the onion: Releases moisture without chunks. Keeps meatloaf incredibly moist.
Free-form on sheet pan: Fat drains away, all sides get browned. Loaf pans trap grease and steam the meat.
The panade: Milk-soaked breadcrumbs keep it tender. Same technique as meatballs.
Italian sausage variation: Use 1 lb beef + 1 lb Italian sausage for more flavor.
Storage: Keeps 4 days refrigerated. Makes excellent sandwiches cold.
